thread.title: Your Facebook profile just got more amazing... or annoying
thread.title_full: Your Facebook profile just got more amazing... or annoying

title: Your Facebook profile just got more amazing... or annoying
text:
Social media editor & Drone Reporter 
Your “pro pic” is so last year. 
Facebook FB, +2.88% has gone all Harry Potter on its profile pictures by introducing “moving profile pictures.” 
Read related: Beware of viral Facebook posts that vow to protect your privacy 
Facebook on Wednesday announced they would start testing profile videos, allowing users to film a short, looping video clip that will play for anyone who visits their profile on a mobile device. 
Moving pictures have become a trend beyond just Harry Potter’s wizarding world and Facebook. More mobile apps are moving beyond static photography, such as Moju , an Instagram-like social network that merges a series of JPEG images to create a 3D effect, and Phhhoto , which creates GIFs of videos. Apple’s AAPL, +0.38% iPhone 6s also has a similar feature called “ Live Photo ,” where the camera extends the capture moment to 1.5 seconds before and after hitting the button. 
Read related: This academic study of people who post selfies confirms everything you suspect 
Facebook also rolled out a few changes to its mobile profiles, including a feature that lets users set a temporary profile picture that automatically reverts back to the original one after a specified period. Another feature creates a space that allows users to curate up to five featured photos on their profiles. 
All of these new features are being rolled out slowly, starting with select users in the U.K. and California. 
But it sounds like not everyone is psyched about the update, particularly these Twitter users:
